meanings.sent1: After the storm passed, they began reoccupying their damaged home.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were reoccupying the strategic hill they had lost the previous day.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept reoccupying the warm spot by the fireplace, no matter how many times it was moved.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were reoccupying her mind, preventing her from focusing on the present.
meanings.sent5: The vines were reoccupying the garden, reclaiming the space with their lush growth.

meanings.definition: To move back into a place previously occupied
meanings.sent1: The family was reoccupying their old farmhouse after years of living in the city.
meanings.sent2: The students were reoccupying their desks after the fire drill was over.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel kept reoccupying the bird feeder, much to the annoyance of the birds.
meanings.sent4: Memories of her childhood were reoccupying her dreams, bringing back long-forgotten moments.
meanings.sent5: The old bookstore was reoccupying its place in the community, drawing in readers with its charm.
